body.name: BOMBING RUN an explosive action packed military aviation thriller adventure novel (Military Aviation Thrillers)
body.description: The year is 1939.The first few months of the Second World War. In England, the air crews of R.A.F Brinstead are readying themselves for the fight ahead.But their commanders have yet to master the brutal realities of this conflict.Bomber squadrons are being sent on daylight reconnaissance and tasked with attacking enemy shipping - and with neither the fighter protection or the firepower to protect themselves from the Luftwaffe.Many of them have little chance of surviving the terrible barrage from the warships' anti-aircraft guns.Flight Sergeant Peter Wheldon is determined to beat the odds and fly his crew safely through each operation.But these early sorties often suffered appalling casualties.And when night raids are added to the bomber crews' burden, Wheldon knows it’ll be hard to get anyone out alive when they are subjected to dangers which will never again be exceeded in the war's six hectic years…Bombing Run is a full-throttle WWII fighter pilot adventure story, rich in authentic period detail. It is perfect for fans of Alistair MacLean and Jack Higgins.'A thrilling page turner.' - Tom Kasey, best-selling author of 'Trade Off'.Richard Townshend Bickers volunteered for the RAF on the outbreak of the second world war and served, with a Permanent Commission, for eighteen years. He wrote a range of military fiction and non-fiction books, including ‘Torpedo Attack’, ‘My Enemy Came Nigh’ and ‘Summer of No Surrender’. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Have never read anything about the Wimpy early in the war. Nice detail and good character development. Hope there is more to come..

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars bomber or bummer
reviews.reviewText: Great story,however a disappointing ending.It left me hanging as if there was more to come... But there wasn't Very frustrating!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars a bit of fantasy...but ok
reviews.reviewText: Some of the situations are hardly true....

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2014
Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars there are better books available on the subject
reviews.reviewText: very slow moving and repetitive. there are better books available on the subject matter

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not bad, but too short
reviews.reviewText: Mr. Bickers books are not badly written,but always seem to end in the middle of the story, leaves you wondering where the rest of the story is.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 25, 2014
reviews.reviewText: Gives a very good idea of the horrors endured by bomber crews. Today's generation can only guess at and be thankful for the efforts and endurance of our forebears. Cover illustration misleading as all the missions were on two engined Wellingtons not the iconic Lancaster shown.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 30, 2014
reviews.reviewText: Let everyone know that Bomber Command crews endured horror out of all proportion to the so called "Few"This book shames Winston Churchill who backed away from up front recognition for political fears.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 23, 2014
reviews.reviewText: ended very quickly for no apparent reason as it was building to a very good story needs a follow up bookmark

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 24, 2014
reviews.reviewText: Not a bad book just finished strangely. As if author had run out of ideas

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 18, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: ... was incomplete and an epilogue would have had a better ending.
reviews.reviewText: i did feel that the ending was incomplete and an epilogue would have had a better ending.
